body:
`spack build-env` is not respecting `target=` specifier when setting up the build environment.

Using:
* `spack@develop`
* 35511c178bddbb228ee5852e4842f9043943e7df
* `Sat Nov 14 23:45:10 2020 +0800`

```
$> spack build-env py-tensorflow+rocm~cuda~nccl target=x86_64 ^python@3 ^py-h5py~mpi ^hdf5~mpi
==> Warning: gcc@7.5.0 cannot build optimized binaries for "zen2". Using best target possible: "zen"
==> Error: Unable to locate perl command in /opt/spack/opt/spack/linux-ubuntu18.04-zen/gcc-7.5.0/perl-5.32.0-bhiayj3jmqk2n5qc2q7wpxh2snm6n3ry/bin
```
title: build-env subcommand not respecting target= specifier
